description: We're helping some London boroughs improve air quality by supporting their Low Emission Neighbourhoods

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["A low emission neighbourhood (LEN) is a scheme aimed at improving air quality and promoting sustainable living in a particular area."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
We are working with the GLA and the London boroughs improve air quality through projects funded by the £20m Mayor's Air Quality Fund (MAQF) .
As part of MAQF, we are supporting 5 LENs
Featured schemes in a LENs include:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Car-free days","Smaller green spaces such as pocket parks","Green cover including vegetation on roofs","Behaviour change initiatives","No idling zones","Coordinated deliveries","Electric vehicles"]}
These LENs will be created by April 2019:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":[" \u003ca href=\"https://www.cityoflondon.gov.uk/business/environmental-health/environmental-protection/air-quality/Pages/Low-Emission-Neighbourhood.aspx\"\u003eBarbican\u003c/a\u003e (City of London)"," \u003ca href=\"https://zeroemissionsnetwork.com/len\"\u003eCity Fringe (Shoreditch)\u003c/a\u003e (Hackney, Islington and Tower Hamlets)"," \u003ca href=\"http://royalgreenwich.gov.uk/lowemissionneighbourhood\"\u003eGreenwich Town Centre\u003c/a\u003e (Greenwich)","Ilford Garden Junction (Newham and Redbridge)"," \u003ca href=\"http://marylebonelen.org/\"\u003eMarylebone\u003c/a\u003e (Westminster)"]}
The total LEN budget is £11m including £5m from the MAQF and the Ultra Low Emission Zone along with committed match funding from boroughs and private sector.
